Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
sdip - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: SDIP Process
Screen.Label: 2D Semblance Dip Mix
OPT_SEMB =
Whether to weight input trace by local semblance.
PWR_SEMB =
Power of semblance for dip mix.
FCTR_MIX =
Fraction of original trace to combine with mixed trace.
WIN_LEN =
Semblance window length in seconds for dip search.
OPT_TAPER =
Type of taper to apply.
DIP_MAX =
Maximum dip in milliseconds per trace.
dip_inc =
Dip increment in milliseconds per trace.
ndips =
Total number of dips which will be tested.
NUM_TR_DIP=
# traces on each side of center trace for dip testing.
ngather =
Total # traces which will be used for dip testing.
NUM_TR_MIX=
# traces on each side of center trace to mix.
nmix =
Total # traces which will be used for mixing.
HDR_LINE =
Header word to identify lines.
LINE_INIT =
Header value for center of first (or any) line.
LINE_INC =
Increment between lines.

Help.Tip: Option whether to weight input trace by the local semblance value.
Help.Text:
sdip - OPT_SEMB
Option whether to weight input trace by the local semblance value.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES/NO
 
 If OPT_SEMB = NO, then only the mixed trace is weighted by the semblance:
 
    TR_OUT = TR_IN * FCTR_MIX + TR_MIX * (1-FCTR_MIX) * SEMB**PWR_SEMB.
 
 If OPT_SEMB = YES, then both the input trace and the mixed trace are weighted
 by the semblance:
 
    TR_OUT = [ TR_IN * FCTR_MIX + TR_MIX * (1-FCTR_MIX) ] * SEMB**PWR_SEMB.
 
 OPT_SEMB = YES results in an output trace that is more strongly modulated by
 the local semblance than if OPT_SEMB = NO.

Help.Tip: Raise local semblance to the PWR_SEMB power for trace weighting.
Help.Text:
sdip - PWR_SEMB
Raise local semblance to the PWR_SEMB power for trace weighting.
 
 Default = 0.5
 Allowed = real >= 0.0

Help.Tip: Fraction of original trace to combine with mixed trace.
Help.Text:
sdip - FCTR_MIX
Fraction of original trace to combine with mixed trace.
 
 Default = 0.5
 Allowed = 0.0 <= real <= 1.0

Help.Tip: Length of the time window, in sec, for the dip search calculation.
Help.Text:
sdip - WIN_LEN
Length of the time window, in sec, for the dip search calculation.
 
 Default = 0.1
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 
 WIN_LEN is used for dip search calculations prior to generating mixed traces.

Help.Tip: Type of taper to apply when forming the mixed trace.
Help.Text:
sdip - OPT_TAPER
Type of taper to apply when forming the mixed trace.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = LINEAR
 Allowed = COSINE
 Allowed = NONE
 
 If OPT_TAPER = LINEAR or COSINE, then a taper is applied to traces to be
 mixed so that the center trace has the greatest weight and the farthest
 traces have the least weight.  Either a linear or cosine taper is used, as
 specified.
 
 If OPT_TAPER = NONE, then the traces to be mixed are all weighted uniformly.

Help.Tip: Maximum dip, in ms/tr, to use in the dip search calculation.
Help.Text:
sdip - DIP_MAX
Maximum dip, in ms/tr, to use in the dip search calculation.
 
 Default = 10.0
 Allowed = real >= 0.0
 
 A total of NDIPS dips are tested, from -DIP_MAX to +DIP_MAX.
 Computer time is roughly proportional to the number of dips tested.

Help.Tip: Dip increment, in ms/tr, to use in the dip search calculation.
Help.Text:
sdip - DIP_INC
Dip increment, in ms/tr, to use in the dip search calculation.
 
 Default = 2.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 
 This value is calculated from the Nyquist frequency and the NUM_TR_DIP
 parameter to keep from aliasing the dip search on the farthest traces.

Help.Tip: Total number of dips to be tested.
Help.Text:
sdip - NDIPS
Total number of dips to be tested.

Help.Tip: Number of traces on each side of the center trace for dip testing.
Help.Text:
sdip - NUM_TR_DIP
Number of traces on each side of the center trace for dip testing.
 
 Default = 3
 Allowed = integer >= 0
 
 A total of (2*NUM_TR_DIP + 1) traces are used in the dip search calculation.

Help.Tip: Total number of traces for dip testing.
Help.Text:
sdip - NGATHER
Total number of traces for dip testing.

Help.Tip: Number of traces on each side of the center trace to mix.
Help.Text:
sdip - NUM_TR_MIX
Number of traces on each side of the center trace to mix.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = integer >= 0 and =< NUM_TR_DIP
 
 A total of (2*NUM_TR_MIX + 1) traces are mixed together.

Help.Tip: Total number of traces to mix together.
Help.Text:
sdip - NMIX
Total number of traces to mix together.

Help.Tip: Header word designating 2D lines.
Help.Text:
sdip - HDR_LINE
Header word designating 2D lines.
 
 Default = 8
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH
 
 HDR_LINE is used to identify 2D lines that SDIP will operate on individually.

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_LINE for the first (or any) 2D line.
Help.Text:
sdip - LINE_INIT
Value of HDR_LINE for the first (or any) 2D line.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 This value must be the center of any bin designating a 2D line.
 This value does not have to correspond to the first actual 2D line.

Help.Tip: Increment of HDR_LINE between 2D lines.
Help.Text:
sdip - LINE_INC
Increment of HDR_LINE between 2D lines.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 This value must be the bin increment (or width) designating a 2D line.

Help.Tip: Message regarding number of requested diagnostic files.
Help.Text:
sdip - MESSAGE
Message regarding number of requested diagnostic files.
 
 This information refers to the diagnostic files requested on the
 "Diagnostic Output Files" screen.  That screen should be visited
 to insure that the requests are correct and the status of each
 requested file is acceptable.

Help.Tip: Base name for pathnames for diagnostic trace output files.
Help.Text:
sdip - BASENAME
Base name for pathnames for diagnostic trace output files.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 This basename is used to create path names for files which will contain
 diagnostic traces.  This basename must not include a filename extension.

Help.Tip: Whether to save edge detection traces to PATH_MEDGE.
Help.Text:
sdip - SAVE_MEDGE
Whether to save edge detection traces to PATH_MEDGE.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for Meek edge detection traces.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_MEDGE
Pathname for Meek edge detection traces.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One edge detection trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 These traces are calculated from moving gathers centered on each input trace.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_MEDGE.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_MEDGE_INFO
Status of PATH_MEDGE.

Help.Tip: Whether to save edge detection traces to PATH_SEDGE.
Help.Text:
sdip - SAVE_SEDGE
Whether to save edge detection traces to PATH_SEDGE.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for semblance edge detection traces.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_SEDGE
Pathname for semblance edge detection traces.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One edge detection trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 These traces are calculated from moving gathers centered on each input trace.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_SEDGE.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_SEDGE_INFO
Status of PATH_SEDGE.

Help.Tip: Whether to save mixed traces to PATH_MIXED.
Help.Text:
sdip - SAVE_MIXED
Whether to save mixed traces to PATH_MIXED.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for mixed traces.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_MIXED
Pathname for mixed traces.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One mixed trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 These traces are calculated from moving gathers centered on each input trace.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_MIXED.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_MIXED_INFO
Status of PATH_MIXED.

Help.Tip: Whether to save semblance traces to PATH_SEMB.
Help.Text:
sdip - SAVE_SEMB
Whether to save semblance traces to PATH_SEMB.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for diagnostic traces of semblance values found.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_SEMB
Pathname for diagnostic traces of semblance values found.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One semblance trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 Semblances are between zero and one.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_SEMB.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_SEMB_INFO
Status of PATH_SEMB.

Help.Tip: Whether to save dip traces to PATH_XDIP.
Help.Text:
sdip - SAVE_XDIP
Whether to save dip traces to PATH_XDIP.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for diagnostic traces of dips found in the X direction.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_XDIP
Pathname for diagnostic traces of dips found in the X direction.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One dip trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 Dips are in milliseconds per trace.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 The traces will be dead if dip searches are not done in the X direction.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_XDIP.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_XDIP_INFO
Status of PATH_XDIP.

Help.Tip: Whether to save dip traces to PATH_YDIP.
Help.Text:
sdip - SAVE_YDIP
Whether to save dip traces to PATH_YDIP.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for diagnostic traces of dips found in the Y direction.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_YDIP
Pathname for diagnostic traces of dips found in the Y direction.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One dip trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 Dips are in milliseconds per trace.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 The traces will be dead if dip searches are not done in the Y direction.
 (This is the case for the 2D SDIP process.)

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_YDIP.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_YDIP_INFO
Status of PATH_YDIP.

Help.Tip: Whether to save original moving gathers to PATH_ORIG.
Help.Text:
sdip - SAVE_ORIG
Whether to save original moving gathers to PATH_ORIG.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for diagnostic traces of original gathers.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_ORIG
Pathname for diagnostic traces of original gathers.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 These are the original moving gathers used for doing the dip search.
 One moving gather will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 Each moving gather contains all of the traces used to do a dip search
 for each trace processed.  Each moving gather will contain
 (2*NUM_TR_DIP_X + 1) times (2*NUM_TR_DIP_Y + 1) traces.
 
 This file can be very large.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_ORIG.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_ORIG_INFO
Status of PATH_ORIG.

Help.Tip: Whether to save flattened moving gathers to PATH_FLAT.
Help.Text:
sdip - SAVE_FLAT
Whether to save flattened moving gathers to PATH_FLAT.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for diagnostic traces of flattened gathers.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_FLAT
Pathname for diagnostic traces of flattened gathers.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 These are the moving gathers as they have been flattened using the results
 of the dip search.  One moving gather will be output to the file for each
 trace processed.  Each moving gather contains all of the traces used to do
 a dip search for each trace processed.  Each moving gather will contain
 (2*NUM_TR_DIP_X + 1) times (2*NUM_TR_DIP_Y + 1) traces.
 
 This file can be very large.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 The traces will be same as original gathers if dip searches are not done.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_FLAT.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_FLAT_INFO
Status of PATH_FLAT.

Help.Tip: Whether to save middle traces to PATH_MIDDLE.
Help.Text:
sdip - SAVE_MIDDLE
Whether to save middle traces to PATH_MIDDLE.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO

Help.Tip: Pathname for middle trace of each moving gather.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_MIDDLE
Pathname for middle trace of each moving gather.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 
 One trace will be output to the file for each trace processed.
 The file will be an 8-bit file.
 
 Each trace output will be the trace from the moving gather which is the
 closest to the output trace location.  Therefore each trace should be the
 same as an original input trace.

Help.Tip: Status of PATH_MIDDLE.
Help.Text:
sdip - PATH_MIDDLE_INFO
Status of PATH_MIDDLE.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
sdip - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
sdip - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
sdip - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
sdip - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
sdip - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
sdip - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
sdip - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
sdip - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
sdip - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
sdip - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
sdip - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : SDIP           (Semblance Dip Mix)
 Category   : filters
 Written    : 1988-12-01   by: Tom Stoeckley
 Revised    : 2006-10-16   by: D. Glover
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Coherence enhancement by mixing along dominant dip direction.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : No.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 SDIP is a 2D coherence enhancement process that operates on stacked or
 migrated lines.  Each input trace is replaced by a mix of itself and its
 neighbors.  Traces are mixed along the direction of dominant dip as
 determined by a semblance search within small windows down the trace.
 
 SDIP uses the MGATHER primitive to maintain a moving gather of traces,
 and the SDIPUTIL primitive to do the dip search and calculate the output
 traces.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         DETAILS OF OPERATION
 
 1. Within each window, (2*NUM_TR_DIP + 1) traces, centered on the input trace,
    are used to perform a semblance dip search to determine which dip has
    the maximum semblance.  A total of (2*DIP_MAX + 1) dips are tested.  The
    dip with the maximum semblance is referred to as the dominant dip.  Each
    window length is WIN_LEN seconds long, and the windows move down the trace
    one sample at a time.
 
 
 2. For each window, (2*NUM_TR_MIX + 1) traces, centered on the input trace,
    are weighted by the taper specified by OPT_TAPER and then mixed along the
    dominant dip to form a mixed trace.
 
 
 3. The output trace is formed from the mixed trace, sample by sample, using
    one of the following two equations:
 
    If OPT_SEMB = NO, then only the mixed trace is weighted by the
    semblance and the output trace is formed as follows:
 
      TR_OUT =   TR_IN * FCTR_MIX  +  TR_MIX * (1-FCTR_MIX) * SEMB**PWR_SEMB
 
    If OPT_SEMB = YES, then the input trace and the mixed trace are both
    weighted by the semblance and the output trace is formed as follows:
 
      TR_OUT = [ TR_IN * FCTR_MIX + TR_MIX * (1-FCTR_MIX) ] * SEMB**PWR_SEMB
 
    where:
 
      TR_OUT   = Output trace.
      TR_IN    = Input trace.
      TR_MIX   = Mixed trace.
      FCTR_MIX = Weighting factor between input and mixed trace.
      SEMB     = Local semblance measured along the dominant dip.
      PWR_SEMB = Power to raise the semblance for semblance weighting.
 
    OPT_SEMB = YES results in an output trace that is more strongly modulated
    by the local semblance than if OPT_SEMB = NO.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                           REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author     Description
     ----        ------     -----------
014. 2006-10-16  D. Glover  Added NULLIFY statements for Intel compiler.
 13. 2002-03-11  Stoeckley  Set limits on number of displayed digits in GUI
                             for floating point numbers to correct an
                             occasional GUI display problem.
 12. 2001-12-11  Stoeckley  Change the DIP_INC_X and DIP_INC_Y parameters
                             to be informational only (now automatically
                             calculated to protect against aliasing);
                             put output diagnostics onto separate trace
                             files so that they can all be obtained at the
                             same time, improve the dip search algorithm.
 11. 2001-08-17  Stoeckley  Move some code to the new SDIPUTIL and TWEIGHTS
                             primitives; add optional diagnostic output.
 10. 2001-06-11  Stoeckley  Change wrapup flag.
  9. 2000-11-27  Stoeckley  Add missing required documentation sections.
  8. 2000-04-25  Stoeckley  Converted from old system.
  7. 1998-11-05  Goodger    Begin using the fortran90 compiler.
  6. 1996-06-03  Vunderink  Added call to MUTEHW to mute input traces.
  5. 1996-05-30  Vunderink  Added call to MUTEHW to mute mixed trace.
  4. 1990-07-09  Stoeckley  Add parameter MT2.
  3. 1989-05-01  Stoeckley  Changed call to modified primitive SEMDIP.
  2. 1989-04-11  Stoeckley  Fix bug in SDIPSCL.
  1. 1988-12-01  Stoeckley  Original Version.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
